column4: Hey, I seem to be having a problem with my WLAN card (Belkin F5D7010, PCMCIA). Installed Dapper last night, all was running fine, configured the card via the networking tool and it worked fine. This morning, unless I remove the wlan card, the boot process stops when configuring network devices. Further to that, if I plug it in while the laptop's running, I'm unable to run most programs (firefox runs, but that's all I could find). Any help would be
when you plug it in and stuff slows down, open up a terminal and type dmesg
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/20193 is the output I got from dmesg
what version of ndiswrapper are you using?
whatever was installed as default... I'll just check
i have 1.8 installed on my dapper, the newest stable is 1.22, on my other machine, compiling it from source made a huge diffrence for me, even speedwise it would go much faster
shall I try disabling whatever drivers are already running and compile ndiswrapper then?
I THINK if you just do a rmmod ndiswrapper then compile the new one and install then modprobe it you're fine, but im not sure
remove all the drivers and configs that you can and redo them all
paste the output of lspci in the pastebin
yeah, RaLink chipset, i've never dealth with them, I would just use ndiswrapper
or if you have money, go out and buy a better card
sadly, that is not an option :(
